page.title: 01South of Buckland Brewer
page.content: This part of North Devon is very hilly with the higher points just over 500 feet. The district is rural, sparsely populated & almost entirely devoted to farming. It contains 14 farms which are mostly small family concerns of about 100 acres. 9 of these are mixed dairy & the remainder deal mainly with beef & sheep. During recent years 6 farms have ceased to exist with the land being sold to neighbouring farms. The area is covered by a network of narrow lanes with high banks & hedges which are so typical of North Devon - the only major road being a short stretch of the Bideford/Holsworthy road which crosses the extreme South East corner of the block. Particular features of the area are the heavily wooded oak escarpments & the lack of trees in the hedgerows due to the high winds.
